text:
DR. DEVI SHETTY:
26 or 27 years ago,

when I did the
first heart surgery,

I clearly remember patient paid
today's equivalent of $2,000
for a heart operation.

26 years later,
they're paying $1200.

Nothing in this
world in service.

What was $2,000, 26 years
later has come down to $1,200.
It's only by economy of scale.
Today, we are privileged.

About 12% of the heart surgery
done in India is done by us.

So we have the companies
which supply products.
They look at us differently.

And we have converted
our hospital
as an academic institution.

Every hospital we
build, we treat it

like an academic institution
to train young people.

And more than anything else,
we are very, very conscious
of the quality.

The cheapest way to
produce something

is to make it the
best in first attempt.
SPEAKER: Why is that?

DR. DEVI SHETTY: Then you
don't have to repair it again.

If you fix the heart properly
during the first time,

you don't need to take back the
patient for a re-exploration,

or give them massive
quantity of blood.
